$TNT doorknob on discord:

Recent talks with management  indicate we will be trading on the NASDAQ by Oct 3rd  at the latest.   Someone in the SEC dept. lumped us in with some companies that are not properly regulated  as per a new set of regulations that came out with the SEC  CALLED "VIE" on Form 40-F filings. They have teams of lawyers from Benchmark
column3: plus Chinese lawyers sent documents that we certainly have followed regulations to a "T"  and are not in that category at all ! The lawyers are working hard to fix this because TNT wants to trade much earlier than Oct 3rd. The NASDAQ is on our side and is not in agreement with the SEC
column4: but TNT wants to remain in good standing with the SEC.  The SEC IMHO put the cart before the horse and should have let us trade until the reviewed it thoroughly to see that we should not have been lumped in with those other companies
column5: hence all the lawyers stepped in as we have significant news we wish to put on cubeler and revised

body: $TNT Anyone else spoken with Peak IR? Any explanation given? Stalling in price action is temporary and we will resume upward trend soon enough. I‚Äôm buying more tomorrow to set up for next week. Long.

$TNT I spoke to IR at Peak.  The SEC reviewer analyzing the 40-F is concerned that Peak is a VIE.  Here is a link on VIEs - https://www.republicworld.com/world-news/china/chinese-companies-using-vie-structure-to-raise-money-from-foreign-investors-report.html

That's what is holding this up.  Peak and the NASDAQ are livid and feel that it is clear that from the information provided that they are not a VIE.  There is supposed  to be reciprocity between Canadian and US regulators.  Peak's registration was approved by Canadian regulators when they raised money earlier in the year.  SEC should honor that.  If the SEC reviewer doesn't come around soon they will go over her head to her superiors.   If this was not an accelerated listing it would have be cleared by October 3.  IR said that is the worst case scenario for it to being trading on NASDAQ again.  Hopefully much sooner.
$TNT I really love taking advantage of people who think and behave like the stock market is like going to the casino. I've done that myself when I started ~25 years ago
created_at: and it took me a few years to realize that the role I was playing was that of a liquidity provider... somebody else was profiting.
